questions.question: What is used to correctly bind an alert to an application?
If you wanted to create a quick response alert rule to open an Ask Jeeves search on the description of the alert, where would it configured?
Where would you find the Priority Breakdown for an Alert?
answers: A. Under the More Information section
D. Under the CI Problems section

questions.question: Where does an operator give feedback on an automated alert grouping?
answers: A. Feedback attribute on the virtual alert record
B. Feedback attribute on the child alert record
C. Feedback attribute on the event record
D. Feedback attribute on the alert record
E. Dropdown box on the alert group record

comments.content:
This Feedback field appears in alert forms only if the alert being modified is a parent alert. Your response provides feedback about the accuracy and usefulness of the group. Possible values are:
- None
- No Feedback
- Yes
Feel like the exam would pick E over D

questions.question: In your environment, no alert CMDB, automated, or text based grouping is occurring. What is most likely the problem?
answers: A. No correlation rules have been defined
B. No event management rules have been defined
C. Application services are not operational
E. The alert correlation property that enables grouping is set to false

comments.content:
To enable creating automated alert groups, set the Enable alert aggregation for Automated, CMDB and Text based groups (sa_analytics.aggregation_enabled)

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/utah-it-operations-management/page/product/event-management/concept/c_SACorrelatedAlertGroups.html
The sa_analytics.aggregation_enabled parameter. Enable creating automated alert group by setting the Enable alert aggregation for Automated, CMDB and Text based groups property to true.

questions.question: The additional information field is a JSON string that gives more information about an event. An example of a supported JSON string is:

comments.content:
D is more proper.
Although A, C, D are all valid JSON, but we should always refer to the existing way ServiceNow supported. In the Now Learning it is stated:
- Supported JSON format "{"MEMORY";"70"}"

A, C, and D are all valid JSON (A is also valid because integers do not necessarily have to be in quotes).

However, note that at this time, ServiceNow only accepts up to ES5 JSON (not ES6 yet), and while there are still three correct answers, C is the most correct, because most examples on the SN doc sites display concatenated k/v pairs more often than not. Examples here:

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/utah-integrate-applications/page/administer/import-sets/reference/json-data-source-examples.html
C and D are both correct?
replies: i guess the "" makes D even more correct. But integers do not have to be in quotes, i believe.

questions.question: In order for SNMP trap notifications to appear in ServiceNow as events, what option must be enabled in the required MID server?
answers: B. SNMP event manager module for MID
C. Event collector MID server extension

questions.question: What event will cause Agent Client Collector self-monitoring to pause data collection?
answers: A. Communication with the MID server is lost
B. The amount of host memory being used by the agent exceeds a threshold
C. Communication with the ServiceNow instance is lost
D. The amount of host disk space used by the agent exceeds a threshold
E. The amount of host CPU being utilized by the agent exceeds a threshold

questions.question: Agent Client Collector can perform application service monitoring by configuring what option?
